text.textblock: Hybrid PFD's; Establishment of Approval Requirements; Correction

action.textblock: Supplemental notice of proposed rulemaking; correction.

summary.textblock: The Coast Guard is correcting errors in the preamble and proposed regulatory text which appeared in the

date.textblock: Comments must be received on or before April 18, 1994.

further.textblock: LTjg Roger A. Smith, Office of Marine Safety, Security, and Environmental Protection, Attn: G-MVI-3/14, 2100 Second Street, SW., Washington, DC 20593-0001, (202) 267-1444.

supplem.textblock: The Coast Guard published an interim final rule promulgating hybrid inflatable PFD requirements in the
on August 22, 1985 (50 FR 33923). The SNPRM published in the
on January 18, 1994 (59 FR 2575) proposes changes to the requirements for approving hybrid PFD's and for the carriage of hybrid PFD's on commercial vessels.
The publication on January 18, 1994, of the Supplemental Notice of Proposed Rulemaking (CGD 78-174), which was the subject of FR Doc. 94-1135, is corrected as follows:
paragraph (j)(4) should be designated paragraph (4) and the word ``added'' should read ``amended''.
paragraph designation (1) should be a lower case (l).
4. On page 2586, first column, in §160.077-27, paragraph (e)(2), under the heading
Hybrid Inflatable Type I, II, or III,
in the fourth sentence ``will not'' should read ``may only'' so it reads ``The buoyancy provided by this PFD when not inflated may only float approximately 90 percent of the boating public.''

signjob.textblock: Rear Admiral, U.S. Coast Guard, Chief, Office of Marine Safety, Security and Environmental Protection.
